0.cdata!:
Mali, Mauritania, and Senegal - Regional
            Hydropower Development Project - environmental assessment

trustfund:
TF023976-FAC CONSULTANT TRUST FUND (USD A/C),TF035840-AFRICA REGION - REGIONAL
            HYDROPOWER PROJECT,TF020195-PHRD-POWER DEVELOPMENT PROJ.

abstracts.cdata!:
This report presents an environmental
            assessment on the implementation of the Regional Hydropower
            Development Project in Mali, Mauritania, and Senegal.
            Harmful and negative impacts due to the implementation of
            the project have been identified, covering biodiversity, as
            well as socio-economic aspects. The lack of early
            consultations with the affected population as of the
            construction of the reservoir in 1988, has created a
            negative approach on the socio-economic front. Furthermore,
            due to flooding and water contamination, endemic diseases
            and malnutrition have affected the population health.
            Mitigation measures have been taken for biodiversity
            protection, such as diverting power lines from the protected
            zones. Nevertheless, the social problems affecting an
            essentially rural population need to be addressed, which
            legislation has, thus far, failed to accomplish. The
            creation of local coordination committees with strong
            representation rights is suggested, to establish the link
            with national governments in order to evaluate health and
            compensation rights, including supplementary retraining and
            monitoring management efficiency. An annex to this report
            will follow covering the environmental plan on the
            development of a sustainable reservoir management system for
            the Manantali Power Project.
